Looks like a corrupt install. Did you extract Eclipse ZIP to an empty directory
or over an existing version (the latter not being supported)?

You may want to try rextracting the ZIP file again (still to an empty location). 

Does that work for you?

Yes, I jave extracted the ZIP file into an empty directory and not over an
existing (not supported) version. I removed the directory and installed eclipse
again (rextracted the ZIP fine into an empty directory). It works for now. But
it's not the first time this has happened.

Did the problematic install start fine ever? Or it failed since the first time
you tried running it?

First, thank you very much for your help. :-)

Yes. I haven't had any problems during the installation and it runs nicely. But
after a while when I'm doing something (for instance this last time it happened
when I wanted to save a modified file) it crashes and when i try to start it
again there is an error message telling me to look in log file. Sometimes
eclipse starts, but I can't open any file and then again sometimes it won't come
up at all.

Said, have you seen this after you reinstalled Eclipse?

Also, do you get other ClassFormatErrors for other classes? Which ones? Thanks.

No more information from originator. Please reopen when you can provide the
information requested above. Thanks.

I have reinstalled several times. Sometimes the error description was something
like this when I tried to start eclips: unable to save workspace.
But I don't have the information in log file anymore. Sorry. And I haven't had
any crashes yet since the last reinstall. Thanks for your help.
If it happens again, please reopen this PR and attach the log file to it. Thanks.
